column4: How does the soundrecognition actually work in Ubuntu, compared to Xubuntu?
i would think that sound recognition would be the same in xubuntu and ubuntu
EXACTLY what I thought, and why I also installed Xubuntu.
are the versions the same for ubuntu and xubuntu?
for example, are you comparing 9.04 to 9.04?
YES, 9.10 and 9.10. Karmic and Karmic.
Working and not working. ?!?!?!
i think you can install fluxbox on ubuntu, maybe that is the easiest solution
What?
How does Fluxbox help me copy the audio-config?

I'm making an assumption that flux is what xubuntu uses, so i was recommeding installing ubuntu on the system with xubuntu, then install flux, if you're trying to learn how audio is configured, then that's another story.
i'm under the impression that pulseaudio is necessary for audio to work out of the box.  you can pgrep pulseaudio on the xubuntu system to see if it's even running.
i installed xfce on this system, liked it, but there were deal breakers
What dealbreakers?
hmmm, need time to recall.  i still have it just in case i need it though

i'm pretty sure colors were an issue.  couldn't get it with the black background, i prefer this color scheme.  also mouse config, my mouse buttons are switched.  oh, more importantly, couldn't organize open apps on the panel
None of those are problems in my Xubuntu-install.
interesting.  i should install in a virtual machine.  maybe after i install zenix in a virtual machine
that means pulseaudio is running and its pid is 3330
Is pulseaudio included in ALSA?
i know on my system, which uses snd_hda_intel "driver" i need the snd_hda_intel module and pulseaudio for it to work
Is pulseaudio kind'a included in ALSA?
i think ALSA and pulseaudio are separate.  pulseaudio is *like* a proxy
this how to might help you out https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HdaIntelSoundHowto
